thread.title: Cinémas Palme D'Or celebrates 12 years with 'The Keeping Room' Q&A this Saturday
thread.title_full: Cinémas Palme D'Or celebrates 12 years with 'The Keeping Room' Q&A this Saturday | Examiner.com

author: Kay Shackleton
title: Cinémas Palme D'Or celebrates 12 years with 'The Keeping Room' Q&A this Saturday
text:
Play In this exclusive clip from the Civil War-set drama, two Southern sisters and their slave (Muna Otaru) prepare to defend themselves against arriving Northern soldiers. on.aol.com Cinémas Palme D'Or in Palm Desert presents an exclusive screening of the new film " The Keeping Room ," starring Brit Marling, Hailee Steinfeld and Sam Worthington. This screening includes a live, in-person Q&A session with the film's writer Julia Hart and the film's producer Jordan Horowitz. This special and exclusive event takes place this Saturday night, November 10, 2015, after the 6:45 pm screening of the motion picture. Seating is first come, first served. Tickets are available on Fandango.com right now. This special Q&A event will be moderated by KNEWS morning personality Bill Feingold.
Poster artwork courtesy of Drafthouse Films. " The Keeping Room ," is a Western-style film set towards the end of the Civil War. It features the story of Southerner Augusta (Brit Marling) who encounters two renegade, drunken soldiers. They seem to be on a mission of violence in pillage. Augusta is nearly assaulted and escapes just in time to run back to her isolated farmhouse. At home is her sister Louise (Hailee Steinfeld) and their female slave named Mad (Muna Otaru). What will these three women do when these Yankees find their home? It's a film that is guaranteed to linger with you long after the credits roll!
Making this evening just a little more special, this date marks the 12th Anniversary of Cinémas Palme D'Or. To celebrate, the theater is offering free popcorn and soft drinks - all day long. Other items will be reduced to special pricing including wine, beer and the Eisenberg hot dog!
"The Keeping Room" is rated R for strong violence including a sexual assault and has a run-time of 95 minutes.
Cinémas Palme D'Or is located in the Westfield Shopping Mall, near JC Penny at 72840 California 111, Palm Desert, California.
